Titulo: Lattice Incorporation of Cu2+ into the BaCe0.7Zr0.1Yb0.1O3-δ Electrolyte on Boosting Its Sintering and Proton-Conducting Abilities for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: S cm(-1) at 700 degrees C) and low temperature (1200 C) sinterability were achieved for the BaCe0.68Zr0.1Y0.1M0.1CU0.02O3-delta (BCZYYC2) electrolyte, compared to the precursor electrolyte.

Sentencas: Meanwhile, the modified BCZYYC2 also exhibits excellent chemical stability in high-temperature and high-humidity conditions, as well as good compatibility with the components of cell.
Titulo: Lattice Incorporation of Cu2+ into the BaCe0.7Zr0.1Yb0.1O3-δ Electrolyte on Boosting Its Sintering and Proton-Conducting Abilities for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: When used as the electrolyte in reversible fuel cell (FC)/electrolysis cell (EC) operational modes, the reversible solid oxide cell with the BCZYYC2 electrolyte illustrates prominent FC (0.85 W cm(-2) at 700 degrees C) and EC (-1.96 A cm(-2) at 700 degrees C and 1.3 V) performances with high film-electrolyte conductivity (8.7 X 10(-3) S cm(-1) at 700 degrees C).
Titulo: Lattice Incorporation of Cu2+ into the BaCe0.7Zr0.1Yb0.1O3-δ Electrolyte on Boosting Its Sintering and Proton-Conducting Abilities for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: Additionally, an obvious increase in current density is observed during the short-term stability test, which has shown great promise for their practical application.
Titulo: Lattice Incorporation of Cu2+ into the BaCe0.7Zr0.1Yb0.1O3-δ Electrolyte on Boosting Its Sintering and Proton-Conducting Abilities for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells
